snippet: President Maithripala Sirisena said this week that he did not have the power to block his predecessor, Mahinda Rajapakse, from running for Parliament.
abstract: Former Sri Lankan Pres Mahinda Rajapaksa is poised for potential comeback after successor Maithripala Sirisena clears path for him to make Parliamentary bid; many, including some of Rajapaksa's former allies, remain deeply skeptical, citing his legacy of corruption.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: President Maithripala Sirisena said this week that he did not have the power to block his predecessor, Mahinda Rajapakse, from running for Parliament.

headline.main: Path Opens for Ex-President of Sri Lanka to Make Comeback
headline.print_headline: Former President of Sri Lanka Sees Opening for a Comeback
